entry.title: Does Ethereum Still Have a Cartel? Glassnode Unpacks Skyrocketing Staking
entry.summary: Lido Finance retains its tight grip on the network’s staking pools, which swelled since the Shanghai upgrade.

entry.title: Is DCA the Way? Diligent Bitcoin Buyers Declared Back in the Black
entry.summary: Dollar cost averaging is a profitable strategy for all committed Bitcoin savers, data shows.

entry.title: Bitget Launches 'Dual-Coin' Crypto Loans to Boost Investor Liquidity
entry.summary: BitGet will let borrowers stake their own coins to back up loans denominated in another.

entry.title: Two Twitter Alternatives Take Flight This Week—What Are Spill and Threads?
entry.summary: Elon Musk adding tweet limits is sending users scrambling. It might have come at the right time for these two new Twitter rivals.

entry.title: ChatGPT Users Abused Web Browsing Feature So OpenAI Has Turned It Off
entry.summary: This is why we can’t have nice things.

entry.title: ‘Crypto Companies Must Get Ready to Comply’: UK Financial Regulator
entry.summary: Authorities have established the rules for companies promoting cryptocurrencies to UK customers. Now, firms need to fall in line.

entry.title: New Bitcoin Standard BRC-69 Removes Data Limit for Ordinals
entry.summary: The innovation is “recursive inscriptions,” which extract information from already existing Bitcoin inscriptions to create newer ones.

entry.title: Political Satirist Slammed for Creating Deepfakes of Trump, Biden Cheating on Their Wives
entry.summary: Images of several politicians engaged in infidelity were created to force a high-level conversation on disinformation.

entry.title: Voyager Creditor Committee to Pay $5.2M in Legal Fees From March to May
entry.summary: Voyager's creditors' legal fees for the fee period running from last July's bankruptcy filing to mid-May this year now totals $16.5 million.

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Gemini Tables 'Final' $1.5B Offer for Barry Silbert's DCG
entry.summary: Gemini again threatened a lawsuit against DCG and Barry Silbert if they fail to accept the latest offer by July 6, saying “your games are over.”

entry.title: Aptos Jumps 10% Overnight as South Korea Trading Volumes Spike
entry.summary: The token powering the popular “Solana Killer” Aptos has seen a hefty rise in its price amid a unique price premium in South Korea.

entry.title: Now You Can Create Tunes via Bitcoin With an On-Chain Music Engine
entry.summary: The app, minted as an NFT-like Ordinal on Bitcoin, showcases the capabilities of “recursive inscriptions” that build upon each other.

entry.title: Belarus Working to Ban P2P Crypto Transactions to Fight Fraud
entry.summary: The country will still allow people to buy and sell crypto through registered exchanges.

entry.title: My Pet Hooligan Could Rival Fortnite With Its Vibrant Battle Royale Combat
entry.summary: PREVIEW: Currently in alpha, My Pet Hooligan offers cheeky lore, fun guns, great movement, and bunnies in their underpants.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Bored Ape Yacht Club Prices Crash to Two-Year Low, Down 88% From Peak
entry.summary: Bored Ape NFTs are leading the charge in a brutal market plunge, but other "blue chip" PFPs are losing steam as well.

entry.title: Bitcoin Hits Its Highest Price in Over a Year
entry.summary: Crypto’s most valuable coin traded hands at prices not seen since last June.

entry.title: Stability AI CEO: There Will Be No (Human) Programmers in Five Years
entry.summary: Many believe AI will bring the end of the world, but Emad Mostaque believes AI (and humans) can change it.

entry.title: BlackRock Refiles for Bitcoin ETF After SEC Flags Flaws
entry.summary: After reports that the SEC found flaws in its initial filing, BlackRock submitted a fresh application for a Bitcoin spot market ETF. If successful, it would be the first Bitcoin spot ETF to win approval.

entry.title: Researchers Are Breaking Ancient Language Barriers With AI
entry.summary: Data scientists are using artificial intelligence to translate Cuneiform and Akkadian into English.

entry.title: Crypto ATM Company Bitcoin Depot Launches on Nasdaq
entry.summary: The Bitcoin ATM provider is the first publicly listed company of its kind in the U.S.

entry.title: Bitcoin Tops $31,000, Ethereum Nears $2,000 as Crypto Rally Continues
entry.summary: Bitcoin is back above $31,000 for the second time in the last week, while Ethereum nears its own recent milestone—and Pepe is surging again.

entry.title: Revolut to Delist Solana, Polygon, And Cardano After SEC ‘Security’ Label
entry.summary: Revolut is moving to delist the three tokens over what it says is regulatory uncertainty after the SEC labeled them securities.

entry.title: World's Oldest Operational Coin Mint Opens Doors to New NFT Exhibit in Paris
entry.summary: Founded in AD 864, La Monnaie de Paris is now turning its attention to the future of money and art.

entry.title: Angry Azuki Elementals Holders Unite to Demand $39 Million Refund, Lose Thousands More in Subsequent Hack
entry.summary: The Azuki DAO, formed last week to coordinate a lawsuit against Azuki founder Zagabond, was targeted by a successful hack early this morning.

entry.title: Thailand Follows Singapore, Bans Crypto Exchanges From Offering Lending Services
entry.summary: Like Singapore, Thailand is putting investor protection at the forefront of its crypto policy approach.

entry.title: Solana Co-Founder Says Ethereum Could Be Layer-2 for SOL
entry.summary: Ethereum becoming a layer-2 for Solana is “probably more likely than you might think,” says Solana Labs co-founder Anatoly Yakovenko.

entry.title: Singapore Regulator Bans Crypto Exchanges from Lending, Staking for Retail Investors
entry.summary: Alongside the staking and lending ban, crypto exchanges are expected to keep user funds in a Trust.

entry.title: Ethereum DeFi Heavyweights Compound, Maker Soar Overnight
entry.summary: The popular lending and borrowing protocols have seen hefty gains over the last 24 hours, which comes on the heels of a recent Ethereum rally.

entry.title: Crypto VC Investment Drops 70% In One Year: Report
entry.summary: June saw the lowest amount of funding from venture capitalists going toward digital assets.

entry.title: SEC Inaction on Spot Bitcoin ETF a 'Complete and Utter Disaster', Says Cameron Winklevoss
entry.summary: The Gemini cofounder cited his decade-old filing for a spot Bitcoin ETF-like trust, also rejected by the SEC.

entry.title: CBDC Skepticism Is Strong in Canada and England, Too
entry.summary: Americans aren’t the only ones wary of a central bank digital currency, two recent surveys show.

entry.title: Poly Network Attack Conjures Billions of Dollars in Tokens That 'Did Not Exist'
entry.summary: The most recent attack follows a record-breaking heist against the crypto platform in 2021.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Brian Armstrong and Jack Dorsey Blast Apple’s App Store Crypto Clampdown
entry.summary: Bitcoin evangelist Michael Saylor wants you to know he’s still Buying Bitcoin—and voting for Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

entry.title: Ubisoft Reveals Next Blockchain Game, Champions Tactics
entry.summary: Assassin’s Creed game maker Ubisoft is developing an original tactical RPG on PC, built on the Oasys blockchain.

entry.title: Kraken Ordered to Hand Over User Information to IRS
entry.summary: A federal court yesterday ordered the crypto exchange to provide names, physical addresses, and social security numbers.

entry.title: 'Rate Limit Exceeded': Elon Musk Riles Twitter Users With Latest Clampdown
entry.summary: Amid a Dogecoin lawsuit and turmoil on Reddit, renewed chaos is sparking another stampede to alternative services.

entry.title: This Week In Coins: Bitcoin Unmoved, But Proof-of-Work Classics Bitcoin Cash and Litecoin Moon
entry.summary: Also, this week’s news surfaced doubts about BlackRock’s Bitcoin spot ETF application.

entry.title: Hong Kong Is 'Embracing' Web3 With New Task Force
entry.summary: The territory’s pro-crypto financial secretary, Paul Chan, says Web3 development represent a "golden opportunity."

entry.title: Skynet Incoming? 'Terminator' Star Arnold Schwarzenegger Warns of AI Threat
entry.summary: Schwarzenegger drew parallels between the fictional Skynet and concerning real-world AI developments that have turned fantasy into "reality."

entry.title: Why Legend of Arcardia Chose Sui Over EVM Chains
entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed title—and made Crypto Unicorns instead.

entry.title: Mythical Games CEO John Linden on NFL Rivals Topping 1M Downloads
entry.summary: Mythical Games just raised a $37 million Series C1 round on the back of the early success of NFL Rivals, which has already topped a million downloads in two months. Mythical CEO John Linden joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss the launch and impact of NFL Rivals.

entry.title: How Ava Labs Is Approaching Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: At 3XP, Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss some of the biggest Avalanche-based games on the horizon and how the company is approaching and thinking about Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Ogimi Founder David Gull on Why AI Should Be Your Meditation Coach
entry.summary: Ogimi founder David Gull speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about its AI-driven meditation guides and how the technology can enable a more unique, custom-tailored meditation experience for users.

entry.title: VaynerSports Gaming VP Discusses Web3 Content Creators, Decentralized Streaming
entry.summary: Darren Glover, VP of Gaming at talent management agency VaynerSports, sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss the challenges faced by Web3-centric content creators, the current state of the esports market, and how decentralized streaming platforms can challenge centralized leaders like Twitch.

entry.title: NYXL Co-Founder on the State of Esports and Crypto Gaming
entry.summary: Rohit Gupta, co-founder of esports team NYXL, chats with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss challenges faced by the esports industry and opportunities and experiments in Web3.

entry.title: What Is GameBridge? Inside Shrapnel's Gaming Innovation
entry.summary: Marc Mercuri, Head of Platform for Web3 shooter Shrapnel, speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo about GameBridge, a feature that simplifies blockchain item composability and interoperability.

entry.title: Gods Unchained Executive Producer Discusses Epic Games Store Move
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, Executive Producer on Immutable X-based card-battler Gods Unchained, discusses the long-running NFT game's launch on the Epic Games Store and the opportunity it provides.

entry.title: 'Play-to-Earn Is Not Dead. It Will Never Die' Says Words with Friends Creator Paul Bettner
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard Creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on Axie Infinity and Web3 games.

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponents—and you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.

entry.title: "AI Is Game-Changing But Needs Fact-Checking": AlchemyAI Project Lead
entry.summary: In this interview, Decrypt's Jason Nelson chats with Alchemy product manager and AlchemyAI project lead Elan Halpern on blockchain analysis using ChatGPT, what AI means for better user experience, and the need to fact-check AI. Halpern also gives a demo of the new AlchemyAI ChatGPT plugin.

entry.title: Fractal Is Like an Arcade, Says Twitch Co-Founder Justin Kan
entry.summary: Justin Kan was a co-founder of Twitch and now works on Fractal, a Web3 gaming startup. Kan tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his new company and what he's up to.

entry.title: Are NFTs the Next SEC Target?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin discusses the current regulatory climate in the U.S. with Gala Games' President of Blockchain Jason Brink.

entry.title: Collab.Land Co-Founder Said There Was No ‘Aha Moment’ When Launching DAO Toolkit
entry.summary: CCO and co-founder of Collab.Land Anjali Young explained at this year’s NFC Lisbon the origins of the crypto community tool kit, which industry niches are turning to its suite of products, and what’s next for the project since its token distribution event last February.

entry.title: Buying a Slice of H.R. Giger's 'Alien' Is Fine Art, Not Memorabilia: Particle CEO
entry.summary: With H.R. Giger's original "Alien" statue on full display at this year's NFC Lisbon, Particle CEO Harold Eytan told Decrypt that owning an NFT-ified slice of the piece isn't just for fans of the iconic creature and movie series but also for fine art collectors. Interested in owning a piece? Be prepared to cough up half an ETH for one of the 500 tranches of the digitized sculpture.

entry.title: Community Co-Creation 'Is a Big Step for Fashion Brands' Entering the Metaverse: BNV Founder and CEO
entry.summary: The founder and CEO of metaverse fashion platform BNV Richard Hobbs said big brands are still nervous to let fans and community members customize their favorite garments. Still, he believes that as long as you can meet a firm's commercial bottom lines while stirring engagement, there's nothing to lose.

entry.title: Standard Crypto VC Co-Founder on NFTs and Their Stigma in Gaming
entry.summary: Alok Vasudev is a co-founder of venture capital firm Standard Crypto. In an interview with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, he shares his thoughts on NFT marketing, NFT utility in gaming, and the stigma that pervades the industry.
